values: If they get a women's clique, I see no reason why we can't have one for the sailors and soldiers. Some would even be welcome in both, I imagine. Particularly with the sort of women who seem to be gathering over there.

It's Amiya.  My dearest, most charmingly explosive Amiya.  Amina would have made things odd with the first mate, whose name ye also got wrong.  :)  It's Ayemmin, propperly written as Ajemin, which is prolly where that confusion came from.  An' his most miraculous daughter, Lulia.  Funny that the one ye were most confused about is the one ye got right.  :) And my ships are not slow, hulkin' lugs, damnit.  Just because they ain't fit to go traipsin' about in a damn reef don't make them lugs.
What the glare-kissed hell was that?!?

I have arrived! I am the Mad Captain Skal of Clewnemor, and admit that I am not the Captain for ye if ya wish someone to ferry goods and annoyances passengers across the sheltered crescent and back all day long. In fact, I'm probably not the Captain for ye unless ye're glare-loved desperate. But if ye really need to get that shipment around the bulk of Folceni before one of the storming seasons truly sets in? I'm the only Captain for ye. Ya poor soul.
